contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the people of Israel. Alternate translation: "the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
The tribes of Reuben, Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh chose to settle east of the Jordan River. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
It may be helpful to say they returned to Jericho. Alternate translation: "their pursuers returned to the city of Jericho" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
The two men returned back to the Israelite's camp. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
This refers to the Jordan River bed. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
Each of the twelve men were to pick up a large stone from the Jordan River bed and carry them to the other side to build a monument. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: into the middle of the Jordan. Each of you is to take up a stone upon his shoulder

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the twelve men picking up stones from the middle of the Jordan River bed. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they picked up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan

contextId.occurrenceNote: These were twelve additional stones, not the stones that the twelve men carried from the river bed. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Then Joshua set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan

contextId.occurrenceNote: These were the soldiers of the 3 tribes that were fulfilling their obligation to lead the Israelites into battle for settling on the East side of the Jordan River. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh passed before the people of Israel formed up as an army

contextId.occurrenceNote: Each tribe was to take one stone from the Jordan River so Joshua could build a memorial of the crossing event. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The twelve stones that they took out of the Jordan

contextId.occurrenceNote: There were over 600,000 males, so it is understood that while Joshua was in charge of this task, many other people helped him. If this would confuse your readers, you may want to make this explicit. Alternate translation: "Joshua and the Israelites made themselves flint knives ... they circumcised all the males" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Joshua made himself flint knives ... he circumcised all the males

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be stated clearly that there were people carrying the ark. Alternate translation: "The priests who were carrying the ark of the covenant of Yahweh followed after them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The ark of the covenant of Yahweh followed after them

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may clarify that this is the land that Israel still needs to capture. Alternate translation: "This is the land that still remains for Israel to capture" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: This is the land that still remains

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Geshur" and "Maacath" are either the names of the ancestors of "the Geshurites" and "the Maacathites" or are the names of the cities in which they lived. Alternate translation: "those people live among Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Geshur and Maacath live among Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: These names represent clans of people who were descendants of Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai. The words "sons" and "descendants" in this context mean the same thing. Alternate translation: "the three clans, Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, who were descendants of Anak" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman and Talmai, descendants of Anak

contextId.occurrenceNote: The "tribe of Joseph" consisted of the tribes of Joseph's two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim. Since half of the tribe of Manasseh had settled east of the Jordan, this phrase refers to the tribe of Ephraim and the other half of the tribe of Manasseh. Alternate translation: "the tribe of Ephraim and the other half of the tribe of Manasseh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
This refers to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
This refers to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
